meanings.definition: Having a jagged or irregular edge
meanings.sent1: The erose paper had rough edges.
meanings.sent2: The old, erose fence needed repair.
meanings.sent3: The erose cookie looked like it had been nibbled on by a mouse.
meanings.sent4: The erose mountain range stood sharp against the sky.
meanings.sent5: The erose rock felt sharp to the touch.

meanings.definition: To have a jagged or irregular edge
meanings.sent1: She carefully erosed the paper to create a torn edge.
meanings.sent2: The river erosed the banks over time.
meanings.sent3: He erosed the bread crusts to feed the birds.
meanings.sent4: Time eroses memories like waves on the shore.
meanings.sent5: The wind eroses the sand dunes slowly but surely.

meanings.sent1: The erose cliffs overlooked the crashing waves.
meanings.sent2: The erose pottery had a unique charm.
meanings.sent3: The erose puzzle pieces were difficult to fit together.
meanings.sent4: Her erose handwriting made it hard to read her notes.
meanings.sent5: The erose leaves rustled in the breeze.
